items.title: Ceasefire begins but IDF to remain in Gaza Strip until Hamas disarms, Netanyahu says
items.summary: The Israel Defense Forces announces a ceasefire has begun, but Benjamin Netanyahu says Israeli forces will remain in Gaza to pressure Hamas until it disarms.

items.title: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado awarded Nobel Peace Prize
items.summary: The Venezuelan opposition leader is awarded the prize for "her tireless work promoting democratic rights" in the country.

items.title: Latest finance news
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: SA government 'cautiously optimistic' about toxic algal bloom
items.summary: SA government officials say there are some positive signs around the toxic algal bloom crisis as it continues to affect the state's metropolitan beaches.

items.title: Japan's ruling coalition splits, throwing Takaichi's PM bid into doubt
items.summary: Japan's Komeito party on Friday said it would quit its coalition with the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP). Its departure could trigger an unwinding of the so-called "Takaichi trade", which had been driven by investor optimism around fiscal stimulus.

items.title: Coalition frontbencher tries to reframe immigration policy debate
items.summary: Shadow Immigration Minister Paul Scarr has called for a "measured and considered" debate over migration levels after incendiary comments by members of the party's right flank.

items.title: Hoop pine may set record as Australia's tallest rainforest tree
items.summary: Researchers mapping millions of trees as part of a climate change study think they have found Australia's tallest rainforest tree.

items.title: FBI 'seizes and destroys' website linked to hackers threatening to release Qantas customers' data
items.summary: The seizure comes less than 24 hours before a deadline set by the hackers for around 40 global firms to pay a ransom to prevent the release of sensitive information is due to end.

items.title: Protecting rock art from wasp nests in Central Australia's Trephina Gorge with chopsticks and brushes
items.summary: Rock art has significant cultural importance to traditional owners, and is a highlight for visitors who make the hike to see it. These Ltyentye Apurte Rangers are working to help keep them protected from wasp nests.

items.title: Brodie Kostecki sets qualifying record to snare Bathurst 1000 provisional pole
items.summary: Brodie Kostecki looks a strong chance to become the third driver to claim three consecutive Bathurst 1000 poles after going fastest in Friday's qualifying session.

items.title: Correspondent Matthew Doran at Hostage Square in Tel Aviv
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: University of Sydney staff member suspended over verbal outburst against Jewish students
items.summary: Video shows the group of Jewish students being verbally abused and intimidated by the University of Sydney female staff member, before she was moved along by security.

items.title: State government urged to reject Comiskey Group's Coochin Fields music festival site
items.summary: A coalition of Sunshine Coast community groups is calling on the state government to scrap a major music festival development because of ecological concerns raised by the State Assessment and Referrals Agency.

items.title: Socceroos wary of Canada ahead of international friendly in Montreal
items.summary: In the build-up to Saturday's match in Montreal, Socceroos coach Tony Popovic feels Canada has given his squad the ultimate compliment.

items.title: Former Olympic basketballer Danny Morseu 'disappointed' retrial abandoned
items.summary: Danny Morseu's conviction has been wiped but he says he will struggle to find a job, a home, and a source of income after Queensland's Director of Public Prosecutions decided not to pursue a retrial.

items.title: Can you ever throw out a previous home owner or renter's mail?
items.summary: Even years after moving in, you might still be receiving someone else’s bills and letters. Here’s what can you do about it.

items.title: Sydney rock oysters to be grown at Lakes Entrance on the Gippsland Lakes
items.summary: Victoria could have its own Sydney rock oyster industry after a trial in the state's east yielded positive results.

items.title: Patients may not see benefits of $8.5 billlion bulk-billing boost for four years
items.summary: Patients may not see the benefits of higher bulk-billing for years, and average-out-of-pocket costs are expected to rise, the health department has conceded — despite $8.5 billion being tipped into the GP subsidy scheme from November.

items.title: Australia 'still optimistic' Pat Cummins will play first Ashes Test against England
items.summary: With the opening men's Ashes Test six weeks away, Australia coach Andrew McDonald is not willing to rule out Pat Cummins taking the field in Perth.

items.title: Vladimir Putin says Russian air defences were to blame for Azerbaijani jetliner crash
items.summary: The Russian president makes his first public admission of responsibility for the crash, in an effort to improve relations with Azerbaijan.

items.title: David Pocock reinvited to parliament sports club after prime minister weighs in
items.summary: The former star Wallabies player turned independent senator was kicked out of the social sports club after raising concerns about its links to the gambling industry.

items.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock says First Home Guarantee could lead to riskier loans
items.summary: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says the federal government's First Home Guarantee scheme could see some Australians taking out riskier loans.

items.title: Two dead after magnitude-7.4 Philippines earthquake sparks tsunami warnings
items.summary: The quake hit in the Mindanao region at a depth of 62 kilometres below ground level and could cause hazardous tsunami waves along coasts within 300km of the epicentre, seismology authorities say.

items.title: Working dog makes championship comeback after leg amputation
items.summary: Cheese was on track to be a champion when an accident cut his working dog trial career short. A year on from a leg amputation, the border collie is back in the yards and the winner's circle.

items.title: Judge dismisses Drake's lawsuit over Kendrick Lamar diss track Not Like Us
items.summary: The judge says a reasonable listener could not have concluded that Not Like Us was conveying objective facts about Drake.

items.title: Matildas confirm return of Sam Kerr to squad for England and Wales friendlies
items.summary: Sam Kerr is back in the Matildas squad for the first time since late 2023, ahead of friendlies against Wales and England.

items.title: PM says there's 'nothing unusual' in Treasury meeting on contentious superannuation tax proposal
items.summary: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

items.title: Cairns faces prospect of water restrictions at wettest time of year
items.summary: Cairns residents are urged to cut down on their water use as multiple infrastructure failures put the city at risk of water shortfalls heading into summer.

items.title: Public health alert for nitazenes issued after person dies in Queensland
items.summary: Queensland Health issues a public health alert warning nitazenes have been detected in tablets.

items.title: Princess Kate warns screen time feeds 'epidemic of disconnection' that threatens child development
items.summary: In a joint essay with a Harvard Medical School professor, Princess Kate says the young generation may be the most digitally connected but is "simultaneously being more isolated".

items.title: Synergy apologises after overcharging customers $40 million
items.summary: More than 170,000 customers have been overcharged a total of $40 million by WA's state-owned energy retailer Synergy since 2009, sparking an apology from its CEO.

items.title: Hollywood icon Paul Feig to take audiences behind-the-scenes of Bridesmaids at SXSW Sydney
items.summary: Hollywood director Paul Feig has a special strategy that's served him well when it comes to making popular movies and television shows that stand the test of time.

items.title: Three people detained in Belgium over suspected terror plot to attack politicians with drone
items.summary: Three people are detained after an "improvised device" is found at the home of one of the suspects in an investigation into terrorist activities.

items.title: Federal government investigates PFAS spread in Rockhampton amid concern for property prices
items.summary: Christine Stasch was planning to sell her family farm and retire further north. Now, she is fighting for compensation after discovering PFAS contamination on her property.

items.title: Principals' power to ban aggressive parents from school grounds to extend to social media behaviour
items.summary: Principals in Victoria already have the power to ban aggressive or violent parents from school grounds, but the state government is looking to apply the power to parents' behaviour on social media.

items.title: Several Australian Gaza flotilla activists home after being detained by Israel
items.summary: Australians who were on the Global Sumud Flotilla, a fleet of ships intercepted by Israel's navy off Gaza last week, are met by supporters upon their arrival.

items.title: Industrial businesses to ramp-up noise monitoring over humming noise in Sydney's north-west
items.summary: The NSW environmental watchdog has acted on complaints by residents in Sydney's north-west who have been kept awake at night by a disturbing humming noise.

items.title: Netanyahu and US envoys address media after Cabinet meeting
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Australia's dark matter experiment construction nears completion
items.summary: Deep underground in an old gold mine in regional Victoria, scientists enter a worldwide race to understand the composition of dark matter.

items.title: Israeli government approves phase one of Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal
items.summary: The Israeli government has approved Gaza's ceasefire and hostage deal, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said early on Friday.

items.title: When is the Nobel Peace Prize awarded? Who decides the winner?
items.summary: As we wait for the announcement tonight, let's unpack how the awards work.

items.title: Indonesia urges respect for its sovereignty after Australia-PNG defence treaty
items.summary: The landmark agreement commits both countries to "meet the common danger" in the event of an armed attack on either. With that, questions have been raised about Australia's role if the conflict in West Papua escalates.

items.title: Novak Djokovic advances to Shanghai Masters semifinals, qualifier Valentin Vacherot continues fairytale run
items.summary: Fourth seed Novak Djokovic battled past a spirited Zizou Bergs 6-3 7-5 on Thursday to reach the Shanghai Masters semifinals for a 10th time, setting up a clash with surprise package and world number 204 Valentin Vacherot.

items.title: AFL trade period, day five recap: Geelong opens Charlie Curnow bidding as Sydney looms, Ben Ainsworth and Campbell Chesser join Blues
items.summary: The chase for Carlton star Charlie Curnow heated up on day five of the AFL trade period, with Geelong seeing an offer rejected as Sydney prepared its bid.

items.title: Letitia James, NY attorney general and Donald Trump foe, indicted for bank fraud
items.summary: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of US President Donald Trump, is indicted for bank fraud.

items.title: Hamas is trusting Trump as his 'eternal peace' in Gaza turns into a shaky ceasefire
items.summary: With Israel and Hamas not sticking to Donald Trump's proposed "20-point plan", the deal to bring "eternal peace" in the Middle East looks more like a temporary ceasefire.

items.title: What the State of WA’s appeal of Dion Barber’s $2.8 million compensation win could mean for abuse survivors
items.summary: Less than a decade after the door opened for victims of historic child sexual abuse to seek justice in WA, abuse survivors could be at risk of having that door shut again, writes Cason Ho.

items.title: Rain causes crashes during first Bathurst 1000 practice sessions on Mount Panorama
items.summary: Supercars heavyweights Triple Eight lead the charge into the Bathurst 1000 with one eye on the trophy and another on the weather forecast.

items.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock fronts Senate hearing, ASX ends the week lower — As it happened
items.summary: Michele Bullock says either shoppers or merchants will have to pay more under the central bank's proposed debit and credit card changes. The ASX closed lower after oil and gold prices retreated.

items.title: Two dead on private property in Tasmania after tree falls in wild winds
items.summary: Two people have died after a tree fell on them on a rural property in Tasmania's north-west, during Friday's severe winds and wet weather, police say.

items.title: The NT's first Alice Springs-based police commissioner has a rocky road ahead
items.summary: Martin Dole has been a Northern Territory police officer for nearly 30 years — but as the new commissioner, his most challenging role now lies ahead.

items.title: New statistics show Victoria's most dangerous roads are in regional areas
items.summary: In regional Victoria, potholes are not being fixed and major rural road projects have stalled, despite the loss of life from accidents.

items.title: South Africa defeat India by three wickets in Women's Cricket World Cup at Visakhapatnam
items.summary: South Africa defeats co-hosts India by three wickets in the group stage of the Women's Cricket World Cup.

items.title: Man returns to boxing after sepsis forces partial amputations of his arms and legs
items.summary: Adam Smith became "fixated" on returning to the gym after sepsis forced the partial amputation of his arms and legs. Now he can press 365 kilograms and get back into boxing.

items.title: Federal politics: PM congratulates Donald Trump for clinching Gaza peace deal — as it happened
items.summary: The prime minister has congratulated the US president for helping clinch a peace deal with Israel and Hamas to bring the conflict in Gaza to an end.

items.title: Global pilot shortage could mean more delays after push to raise retirement age
items.summary: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

items.title: Why Alliyah is identifying themselves as a victim-survivor — and the power this act holds
items.summary: Alliyah's decision to talk about their abuse was a brave act that exposed the red flags that weren't caught along the way — and they hope it helps others.

items.title: Beyond Blue survey finds loneliness has deeper impact on some Australians' mental health than financial hardship
items.summary: A new national report by Beyond Blue has revealed loneliness and social isolation has reached new heights, with 46 per cent of respondents listing it as a bigger mental health stressor than financial hardship.

items.title: Coal-fired power stations to operate in Queensland until least 2046 as energy road map unveiled
items.summary: The five-year plan lays out what role coal, gas, wind, solar, pumped hydro and battery storage will play over the long-term in Queensland.

items.title: The US sees Pacific Islands as 'tip of the spear', but locals fear becoming China's 'bullseye'
items.summary: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

items.title: Will the Liberals hold firm in the fight over freedom of information?
items.summary: Crossbenchers are joining forces to condemn the government's FOI bill, calling for its withdrawal and an independent inquiry. Will the Coalition stand for transparency?

items.title: Sick sea turtle rescued from algal bloom recovering at Adelaide Zoo
items.summary: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

items.title: Paul Brereton 'consulted' for ADF watchdog 11 times while head of NACC, Senate estimates hears
items.summary: Paul Brereton and Labor politicians had previously stated he had stepped away from the body and resigned as assistant inspector-general of the ADF prior to taking on the top integrity job.

items.title: Ceasefire announcement met with joy and some scepticism in Israel and Gaza
items.summary: The announcement of an agreement to phase one of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas brings great joy to many people in Israel and Gaza.

items.title: First Guardian super trustee Diversa 'ticked off' investments, says former financial adviser Ferras Merhi
items.summary: A former financial adviser involved in placing thousands of clients into the First Guardian Master Fund says he was given clearance by superannuation trustee Diversa to do so after the trustee initially flagged compliance concerns.
